issue.title: Globe.gl + Svelte (Cannot set properties of null (setting 'innerHTML'))
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to render a simple globe using Svelte. Code below:

`

	import Globe from 'globe.gl'

	const container = document.getElementById('globeViz') as HTMLElement;

	Globe()(container);

<div id="globeViz" />

`

What am I missing? Running on Chrome, I get this error in the console:

globe.gl.module.js:478 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set properties of null (setting 'innerHTML')
    at Function.init16 (globe.gl.module.js:478:13)
    at initStatic2 (kapsule.module.js:139:14)
    at comp (kapsule.module.js:133:7)
    at instance (App.svelte:9:3)
    at init (index.mjs:1997:11)
    at new App (App.svelte:9:89)
    at createProxiedComponent (svelte-hooks.js?v=711e1c0b:341:9)
    at new ProxyComponent (proxy.js?v=711e1c0b:242:7)
    at new Proxy<App> (proxy.js?v=711e1c0b:349:11)
    at main.js?t=1669912803246:4:13

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows
 - Browser: Chrome
 - Version: Version 108.0.5359.72 (Official Build) (64-bit)

comment.body:
@th3d4v1d it looks like your `container` variable is set to `null`. Are you certain there is an element with id `globeViz` in your page?

If you're still having issues, please create an online example at https://codepen.io/ so we can have a closer look.

issue.title: Can I customize a color gradient link
issue.body: Hello. There is a orange node and a blue node on the canvas. I want to customize a color gradient link, from blue to orange, using force-graph. just like the following pictures： These are the nodes. The above is the link. Is it possible to customize the color gradient link？ Thanks a lot.

comment.body:
@liuguanyu you can use `linkCanvasObject` to customize the style of your links in whichever way you'd like. For example to add a gradient to the line. Essentially you issue canvas paint commands, so if something is possible in canvas it should be possible here.

You can look into [createLinearGradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/createLinearGradient) to achieve this.

issue.title: Submarine cables data
issue.body:
The "submarine cables" example is broken:
https://github.com/vasturiano/globe.gl/blob/671a650/example/submarine-cables/index.html
https://vasturiano.github.io/globe.gl/example/submarine-cables/index.html

This is failing:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/master/web/public/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

Because this repository is now private or deleted:
https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com
([Most recent Internet Archive copy](https://web.archive.org/web/20221110120103/https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com))

The Internet Archive has the data:
https://web.archive.org/web/20220000000000*/https://raw.githubusercontent.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/master/web/public/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

And it can also be found here:
https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

That's also on the Internet Archive:
https://web.archive.org/web/20220000000000*/https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

... But I'm not sure if it's permissible to use the data anymore, it's not clear the API is intended to be public. Presumably using a copy of the old data (while it was still on GitHub) would be OK?

Selecting "About" on https://www.submarinecablemap.com/ shows:
>Any reference to TeleGeography’s Submarine Cable Map, URL, or any screencapture of the map is made available under the [Creative Commons License: Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/). Contact [info@telegeography.com](mailto:info@telegeography.com) to complete the relevant content release documentation.

Looking at the old GitHub repo, this text only talks about the map:
>Our map is made available under the following [Creative Commons License: Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0)](https://web.archive.org/web/20221110120103/https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/).

... But it also gives instructions on downloading the data, and the [LICENSE](https://web.archive.org/web/20220816215911/https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/blob/master/LICENSE) file seems to apply the Creative Commons license to the entire repo, which includes the data.

Seems like the easy & safe fix would be to place a copy of the data (from before the repo was made inaccessible) into this repo. If you'd prefer to keep the data external, or use the latest data, maybe reach out to [info@telegeography.com](mailto:info@telegeography.com) to see if it's OK to use https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

issue.title: Passing a function for the link width prop breaks particle emission
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
If you pass in a function for linkWidth, then particles are generated and then immediately deleted instead of travelling along the link as expected.

**To Reproduce**
Create react-force-graph with particle emission, see linkWidth to a function e.g. linkWidth={(link) => 5}, particles will continue being created, but not travel along links, instead being deleted.

See codesandbox example, change linkWidth to `{(link) => 5}`: https://codesandbox.io/s/silly-carson-jfpydu?file=/src/force-graph.js:1662-1675

**Expected behavior**
Particles should travel along links as usual.

comment.body: @AshleySetter I think the cause of the issue is that you're regenerating your graph data at every refresh. Therefore, as far as the component is concerned, the old links are replaced with all new links, which in consequence resets all the particle states for all the new links.

issue.title: Change colors of arcs dynamically
issue.body:
Hey there, I've been looking around trying to find an example of how to change an arc's color after it's already drawn, but I can't seem to find a way on how to do that, At least not easily, I think.

Using a function or a property for arcColor, does not have any effect except throwing the following error.
```
Uncaught TypeError: can't access property "material", textObj is undefined
    updateObj three-globe.module.js:2435
    updateObjs data-joint.module.js:295
    updateObjs data-joint.module.js:290
    viewDigest data-joint.module.js:271
    threeDigest three-globe.module.js:580
    update10 three-globe.module.js:2415
    digest kapsule.module.js:148
    later index.js:27
three-globe.module.js:2435:8
```

Is there a way to change the color at all, or am I doing something wrong here? 
Thank you!

comment.body:
@EgoMaw if you pass a new value/method onto the `arcColor` prop it should update the colors.

What could happen is that your memoizing the function that you pass onto `arcColor` and therefore the component doesn't know it should rerender the arcs with new colors. If so, make sure your function reference actually changes when your logic does.

issue.title: Example with drei (React-Three-Drei)?
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Hi!! We were wondering, what the easiest way to add a 3d-force-graph inside a R3F Canvas to use it alongside `react-three-drei` and `R3F`components 🤩

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Something similar to this:
```js
<Canvas style={{ position: "fixed" }}>
    <Suspense fallback={null}>
      {/* Camera */}
      <PerspectiveCamera makeDefault position={[0, 0.5, 10]}/>
      {/* Lighting */}
      <ambientLight args={[ambientLight.color, ambientLight.opacity]}/>
      {/* Objects */}
      <ForceGraph3D graphData={data}/>
      {/* Orbit Controls */}
      <OrbitControls ref={orbitControlsRef}/>
    </Suspense>
</Canvas>
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
* We tried passing something like `{new ThreeForceGraph().graphData(myData)}` as a component, as well as the `ForceGraph3D` component itself, but none worked.

**Additional context**
We are looking to work with more models than just the 3d-graph inside the canvas, and for this we would need to treat it as one more component of our Canvas, but as far as we understand the `ForceGraph3D` component is a Canvas itself.

How would you tackle this challenge? Thank you so very much! 🤩

comment.body: @danielbakas I suppose that's a question for the `React-Three-Drei` framework. I'm not directly familiar with it.

issue.title: Link directional arrow placement incorrect with custom node sizes

comment.body:
@pury thanks for creating those examples. There was an issue with the arrow positioning calculation, which was misbehaving when `nodeVal` was set in 3D mode.

I just pushed a fix to [three-forcegraph](https://github.com/vasturiano/three-forcegraph/commit/9dea32fc790dd0644510f13ea4ae0446cf55acb6). Essentially it was interpreting the value of the node as the area instead of the volume of the node (square-root vs cubic-root). That was responsible for the offset that you described.

This is now fixed and published so all you have to do is bump your inner dependency of `three-forcegraph` to the latest (`1.39.8`).

Let me know if this fixes it for you.

issue.title: Chart getting duplicated for every useEffect call in react app

comment.body:
@jeyk333 thanks for reaching out.

This seems to be more of a question around React rather than this Sunburst component.
I can't advise specifically what should be the React pattern for you to use here, maybe a React forum would be more appropriate for that, but reinstantiating a Sunburst chart everytime the data changes (via `useEffect`) is certainly not right.
The chart should be instantiated only once within a single component's lifecycle.

You can also use [react-kapsule](https://github.com/vasturiano/react-kapsule) as it does all the wrapping for you out of the box.

issue.title: Submarine cables data
issue.body:
The "submarine cables" example is broken:
https://github.com/vasturiano/globe.gl/blob/671a650/example/submarine-cables/index.html
https://vasturiano.github.io/globe.gl/example/submarine-cables/index.html

This is failing:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/master/web/public/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

Because this repository is now private or deleted:
https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com
([Most recent Internet Archive copy](https://web.archive.org/web/20221110120103/https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com))

The Internet Archive has the data:
https://web.archive.org/web/20220000000000*/https://raw.githubusercontent.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/master/web/public/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

And it can also be found here:
https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

That's also on the Internet Archive:
https://web.archive.org/web/20220000000000*/https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

... But I'm not sure if it's permissible to use the data anymore, it's not clear the API is intended to be public. Presumably using a copy of the old data (while it was still on GitHub) would be OK?

Selecting "About" on https://www.submarinecablemap.com/ shows:
>Any reference to TeleGeography’s Submarine Cable Map, URL, or any screencapture of the map is made available under the [Creative Commons License: Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/). Contact [info@telegeography.com](mailto:info@telegeography.com) to complete the relevant content release documentation.

Looking at the old GitHub repo, this text only talks about the map:
>Our map is made available under the following [Creative Commons License: Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0)](https://web.archive.org/web/20221110120103/https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/).

... But it also gives instructions on downloading the data, and the [LICENSE](https://web.archive.org/web/20220816215911/https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/blob/master/LICENSE) file seems to apply the Creative Commons license to the entire repo, which includes the data.

Seems like the easy & safe fix would be to place a copy of the data (from before the repo was made inaccessible) into this repo. If you'd prefer to keep the data external, or use the latest data, maybe reach out to [info@telegeography.com](mailto:info@telegeography.com) to see if it's OK to use https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

issue.title: Passing a function for the link width prop breaks particle emission
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
If you pass in a function for linkWidth, then particles are generated and then immediately deleted instead of travelling along the link as expected.

**To Reproduce**
Create react-force-graph with particle emission, see linkWidth to a function e.g. linkWidth={(link) => 5}, particles will continue being created, but not travel along links, instead being deleted.

See codesandbox example, change linkWidth to `{(link) => 5}`: https://codesandbox.io/s/silly-carson-jfpydu?file=/src/force-graph.js:1662-1675

**Expected behavior**
Particles should travel along links as usual.

comment.body: @AshleySetter I think the cause of the issue is that you're regenerating your graph data at every refresh. Therefore, as far as the component is concerned, the old links are replaced with all new links, which in consequence resets all the particle states for all the new links.

issue.title: Change colors of arcs dynamically
issue.body:
Hey there, I've been looking around trying to find an example of how to change an arc's color after it's already drawn, but I can't seem to find a way on how to do that, At least not easily, I think.

Using a function or a property for arcColor, does not have any effect except throwing the following error.
```
Uncaught TypeError: can't access property "material", textObj is undefined
    updateObj three-globe.module.js:2435
    updateObjs data-joint.module.js:295
    updateObjs data-joint.module.js:290
    viewDigest data-joint.module.js:271
    threeDigest three-globe.module.js:580
    update10 three-globe.module.js:2415
    digest kapsule.module.js:148
    later index.js:27
three-globe.module.js:2435:8

Is there a way to change the color at all, or am I doing something wrong here?

comment.body:
@EgoMaw if you pass a new value/method onto the `arcColor` prop it should update the colors.

Hi!! We were wondering, what the easiest way to add a 3d-force-graph inside a R3F Canvas to use it alongside `react-three-drei` and `R3F`components 🤩

issue.title: Link directional arrow placement incorrect with custom node sizes

comment.body:
@pury thanks for creating those examples. There was an issue with the arrow positioning calculation, which was misbehaving when `nodeVal` was set in 3D mode.

I just pushed a fix to [three-forcegraph](https://github.com/vasturiano/three-forcegraph/commit/9dea32fc790dd0644510f13ea4ae0446cf55acb6). Essentially it was interpreting the value of the node as the area instead of the volume of the node (square-root vs cubic-root). That was responsible for the offset that you described.

This is now fixed and published so all you have to do is bump your inner dependency of `three-forcegraph` to the latest (`1.39.8`).

Let me know if this fixes it for you.

We are looking to work with more models than just the 3d-graph inside the canvas, and for this we would need to treat it as one more component of our Canvas, but as far as we understand the `ForceGraph3D` component is a Canvas itself.

How would you tackle this challenge? Thank you so very much! 🤩

comment.body: @danielbakas you can look into the lower level component [three-forcegraph](https://github.com/vasturiano/three-forcegraph), and bring in your own ThreeJS scene scaffolding yourself. That way the 3D force graph will be just an element within your own scene / canvas.

issue.title: Chart getting duplicated for every useEffect call in react app

comment.body:
@jeyk333 thanks for reaching out.

This seems to be more of a question around React rather than this Sunburst component.
I can't advise specifically what should be the React pattern for you to use here, maybe a React forum would be more appropriate for that, but reinstantiating a Sunburst chart everytime the data changes (via `useEffect`) is certainly not right.
The chart should be instantiated only once within a single component's lifecycle.

You can also use [react-kapsule](https://github.com/vasturiano/react-kapsule) as it does all the wrapping for you out of the box.

issue.title: Submarine cables data
issue.body:
The "submarine cables" example is broken:
https://github.com/vasturiano/globe.gl/blob/671a650/example/submarine-cables/index.html
https://vasturiano.github.io/globe.gl/example/submarine-cables/index.html

This is failing:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/master/web/public/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

Because this repository is now private or deleted:
https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com
([Most recent Internet Archive copy](https://web.archive.org/web/20221110120103/https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com))

The Internet Archive has the data:
https://web.archive.org/web/20220000000000*/https://raw.githubusercontent.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/master/web/public/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

And it can also be found here:
https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

That's also on the Internet Archive:
https://web.archive.org/web/20220000000000*/https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

... But I'm not sure if it's permissible to use the data anymore, it's not clear the API is intended to be public. Presumably using a copy of the old data (while it was still on GitHub) would be OK?

Selecting "About" on https://www.submarinecablemap.com/ shows:
>Any reference to TeleGeography’s Submarine Cable Map, URL, or any screencapture of the map is made available under the [Creative Commons License: Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/). Contact [info@telegeography.com](mailto:info@telegeography.com) to complete the relevant content release documentation.

Looking at the old GitHub repo, this text only talks about the map:
>Our map is made available under the following [Creative Commons License: Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0)](https://web.archive.org/web/20221110120103/https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/).

... But it also gives instructions on downloading the data, and the [LICENSE](https://web.archive.org/web/20220816215911/https://github.com/telegeography/www.submarinecablemap.com/blob/master/LICENSE) file seems to apply the Creative Commons license to the entire repo, which includes the data.

Seems like the easy & safe fix would be to place a copy of the data (from before the repo was made inaccessible) into this repo. If you'd prefer to keep the data external, or use the latest data, maybe reach out to [info@telegeography.com](mailto:info@telegeography.com) to see if it's OK to use https://www.submarinecablemap.com/api/v3/cable/cable-geo.json

issue.title: Passing a function for the link width prop breaks particle emission
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
If you pass in a function for linkWidth, then particles are generated and then immediately deleted instead of travelling along the link as expected.

**To Reproduce**
Create react-force-graph with particle emission, see linkWidth to a function e.g. linkWidth={(link) => 5}, particles will continue being created, but not travel along links, instead being deleted.

See codesandbox example, change linkWidth to `{(link) => 5}`: https://codesandbox.io/s/silly-carson-jfpydu?file=/src/force-graph.js:1662-1675

**Expected behavior**
Particles should travel along links as usual.

comment.body: @AshleySetter I think the cause of the issue is that you're regenerating your graph data at every refresh. Therefore, as far as the component is concerned, the old links are replaced with all new links, which in consequence resets all the particle states for all the new links.

issue.title: Change colors of arcs dynamically

Hey there, I've been looking around trying to find an example of how to change an arc's color after it's already drawn, but I can't seem to find a way on how to do that, At least not easily, I think.

Using a function or a property for arcColor, does not have any effect except throwing the following error.
```
Uncaught TypeError: can't access property "material", textObj is undefined
    updateObj three-globe.module.js:2435

issue.title: Link directional arrow placement incorrect with custom node sizes

comment.body:
@pury thanks for creating those examples. There was an issue with the arrow positioning calculation, which was misbehaving when `nodeVal` was set in 3D mode.

I just pushed a fix to [three-forcegraph](https://github.com/vasturiano/three-forcegraph/commit/9dea32fc790dd0644510f13ea4ae0446cf55acb6). Essentially it was interpreting the value of the node as the area instead of the volume of the node (square-root vs cubic-root). That was responsible for the offset that you described.

This is now fixed and published so all you have to do is bump your inner dependency of `three-forcegraph` to the latest (`1.39.8`).

Let me know if this fixes it for you.

Reporting issue:
When panning the 3d graph, sometimes I need to reposition the entire network diagram.

I found I can do this by dragging with right mouse click.

However, when doing so, the controls are VERY sensitive. A fast mouse can easily get the graph lost and require some further actions to get back into a good state. Furthermore, the other controls seem to act different after having used the right mouse drag feature often requiring a page refresh to get back into a good state.

Also are there any controls for this feature, like changing the trigger?

Also I love this library so much, using on angular12 no problems, thank you!

issue.title: Example with drei (React-Three-Drei)?
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Hi!! We were wondering, what the easiest way to add a 3d-force-graph inside a R3F Canvas to use it alongside `react-three-drei` and `R3F`components 🤩

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Something similar to this:
```js
<Canvas style={{ position: "fixed" }}>
    <Suspense fallback={null}>
      {/* Camera */}
      <PerspectiveCamera makeDefault position={[0, 0.5, 10]}/>
      {/* Lighting */}
      <ambientLight args={[ambientLight.color, ambientLight.opacity]}/>
      {/* Objects */}
      <ForceGraph3D graphData={data}/>
      {/* Orbit Controls */}
      <OrbitControls ref={orbitControlsRef}/>
    </Suspense>
</Canvas>
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
* We tried passing something like `{new ThreeForceGraph().graphData(myData)}` as a component, as well as the `ForceGraph3D` component itself, but none worked.

**Additional context**
We are looking to work with more models than just the 3d-graph inside the canvas, and for this we would need to treat it as one more component of our Canvas, but as far as we understand the `ForceGraph3D` component is a Canvas itself.

How would you tackle this challenge? Thank you so very much! 🤩

comment.body: @danielbakas you can look into the lower level component [three-forcegraph](https://github.com/vasturiano/three-forcegraph), and bring in your own ThreeJS scene scaffolding yourself. That way the 3D force graph will be just an element within your own scene / canvas.

issue.title: Chart getting duplicated for every useEffect call in react app

comment.body:
@jeyk333 thanks for reaching out.

This seems to be more of a question around React rather than this Sunburst component.
I can't advise specifically what should be the React pattern for you to use here, maybe a React forum would be more appropriate for that, but reinstantiating a Sunburst chart everytime the data changes (via `useEffect`) is certainly not right.
The chart should be instantiated only once within a single component's lifecycle.

You can also use [react-kapsule](https://github.com/vasturiano/react-kapsule) as it does all the wrapping for you out of the box.

But in any case, in React you're already passing the `labelsData` as prop into the component, so you have it there readily available for reading and manipulation.
